Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk xfsprogs
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: xfsprogs bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The xfsprogs packages contain a set of commands to use the XFS file system, including the mkfs.xfs command to construct an XFS system. The xfsprogs packages have been upgraded to upstream version 3.2.1, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1119940) This update also fixes the following bugs: Previously, when the "xfs-quota report -h" command was executed on a path or device that did not exist, xfs-quota terminated unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. This bug has been fixed, and xfs-quota now informs the user about a nonexistent device with a warning message. (BZ#1077826) Previously, when the "xfs-quota report -h" command was executed on a symbolic link to the real device, xfs-quota returned the "No such device or address" message. This bug has been fixed, and xfs-quota accepts symbolic links as expected. (BZ#1077841) When the sector size of the source file system was larger than 512 bytes, the xfs_copy utility could create a corrupted copy of that system. In addition, the utility exited with a non-zero return code in all cases, even if the operation was successful. This update applies a patch to fix these bugs and the utility now works as expected. (BZ#1100376, BZ#1105170) Prior to this update, the mkfs.xfs utility failed to create a file system using sparse files hosted on 4k-sector file systems. This bug has been fixed, and mkfs.xfs now operates correctly on sparse files. (BZ#1101236) Previously, if xfs_repair of a file system with stripe geometry copied a backup superblock due to a damaged primary superblock, it caused the stripe geometry to zero out. Consequently, an inconsistency with the backup superblocks occurred, which a subsequent xfs_repair noted as corruption. With this update, the backup superblock stripe geometry is copied to the primary superblock, and the file system is wholly consistent after the first repair. (BZ#1150857) Prior to this update, xfs_repair was calculating the maximum allowable file offset incorrectly , which led to an incorrect report of corruption when a file existed with a logical block offset at the file system design limit. With this update, xfs_repair has been fixed so that the aforementioned behavior is not identified as corruption. (BZ#1173146) Users of xfsprogs are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
